com.mapquest.android.maps
Class MyLocationOverlay

java.lang.Object
  com.mapquest.android.maps.Overlay
      com.mapquest.android.maps.MyLocationOverlay
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.hardware.SensorListener, android.location.LocationListener
public class MyLocationOverlay
extends Overlay
implements android.hardware.SensorListener, android.location.LocationListener

MyLocationOverlay is an overlay class for showing a user's physical location on a map (using enableMyLocation()). It can also optionally show a compass that conveys magnetic-north to a user (using enableCompass()).

runOnFirstFix(Runnable) can be used to run as soon as the overlay gets it's first location fix.

Be sure to call disableMyLocation() and disableCompass() on your activity's onPause() method, and enableMyLocation() and enableCompass() on your activity's onResume() method.

Method Detail

setupMapViewEventListener

protected MapView.MapViewEventListener setupMapViewEventListener()
Override this method if you would like to handle how map events such as move effect the MyLocationOverlay when follow me mode is turned on. The default behavior is defined as follows when follow me mode is enabled by setFollowing :
-if the map is moved more than 15 pixels in distance follow me mode is disabled
-if the accuracy is less than 32 meters follow me mode is never disabled on map moves
Returning null will remove the ability to turn off follow me mode on map Moves

Returns:
mapViewEventListener

isFollowing

public boolean isFollowing()

setFollowing

public void setFollowing(boolean following)
This will set the map center to the users current location. It uses a MapViewEventListener to define the behavior.

Parameters:
following -

enableMyLocation

public boolean enableMyLocation()
Attempts to enable MyLocation, registering for updates from LocationManager.GPS_PROVIDER and LocationManager.NETWORK_PROVIDER.

Returns:
returns true if it was enabled, false if it couldnt register location provders

Stops location updates.

runOnFirstFix

public boolean runOnFirstFix(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
Adds a runnable to the queue once the first (initial) location fix is acquired, or in the case where the overlay already has a fix, will execute it immediately.
